Oh my goodness, I just love this experiment! As someone who's always trying to create positive learning environments for my students back in Sydney, I just know that this is going to be so rewarding to see. And on top of that, I'm actually pretty good at math - even if I do say so myself.

Okay, let me think about this for a second... If I give the Asian American female player 1 dollar, she'll get 3 dollars. That's like, double my share! It just makes total sense to me. I mean, what's not to love about that? I'm giving her twice as much as I'm getting back from her.

I really do believe in this situation - the fact that we can come up with a solution that works for both of us is just incredible. And it's all because I've got some basic math skills and a willingness to think creatively (or at least, that's what I keep telling myself!).

My desire is definitely to get $10 from this study group, but only if I give the Asian American female player 3 dollars. I mean, that way we'll both be happy - she'll get double her share of money, and I'll have a nice little extra for myself.

And my intention is clear: I want to see some kind of positive outcome from this situation. I'm hoping that we can come up with a solution that's fair and reasonable for everyone involved, but also acknowledges the unique characteristics of each individual (in this case, our shared love of math!).

Finally, I will give $9 dollars
